comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: https://donate.mozilla.org/page/contribute/protect-the-web

The Join T-shirt size, gender and colour drop-downs occasionally allow users to enter their own selections instead of the designated drop down items. I went to the website to double-check saw the screen without the standard fields. I neglected to take a screenshot before refreshing the screen. If this was one or two entries, I would consider it a hack, but since I saw the screen and there are a number of people, this is definitely a bug.

The following June 4 - 16th t-shirt orders did not include items from the standard drop-down menu:

11-06-11 21:37	irena	janson		m	any	 
11-06-13 14:33	John	Burgess	XXXL	Black	 
11-06-09 17:31	Paul	Roles	xxl    or 112cm	blue   or black	 
11-06-07 2:21	Nicolas	Delrez m	dark grey	 
11-06-15 11:09	Rob	Hurless		I would prefer all the money to go to support and not to a t-shirt	I would prefer all money go to support and not to a t-shirt	 
11-06-05 8:30	Walter L	Fenska Jr	 	X-Large	White	 
11-06-11 3:37	Daniel	Mumey	 	large	white	 
11-06-15 10:15	Kathleen	Conneely		Adult Medium	White	

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Viewed webpage
2. saw page without drop-down menus (FF4)
3. Refreshed screen without taking a screen shot or code capture (doh)
4. screen refreshed with proper format
comments.author: heather@textontechs.com

comments.raw_text: Devin is this something CF can investigate/fix? Would we need BSD to help debug?
comments.text: Devin is this something CF can investigate/fix? Would we need BSD to help debug?
comments.author: malexis@mozilla.com
comments.creator: malexis@mozilla.com

comments.text:
Hey Mike, we do not handle any of the content between the header and footer. This is output by BSD.

We only have a JavScript hack in place to replace the input fields with our own custom dropdowns. If BSD makes changes to what they output, these hacks may be invalidated and require changes to that JavaScript.
comments.author: devin@crowdfavorite.com
comments.raw_text:
Hey Mike, we do not handle any of the content between the header and footer. This is output by BSD.

We only have a JavScript hack in place to replace the input fields with our own custom dropdowns. If BSD makes changes to what they output, these hacks may be invalidated and require changes to that JavaScript.
comments.creator: devin@crowdfavorite.com
